archive_access_date: The date and time when the archive file was last accessed.
archive_checksum: The checksum or hash value of the archive file for verifying its integrity.
archive_comments: Any comments or notes related to the archive file.
archive_compression_level: The level of compression used for the archive (e.g. high, medium, low, etc.).
archive_contents: A list of the files and directories contained within the archive.
archive_creation_date: The date and time when the archive file was created.
archive_creator: The name of the individual or organization that created the archive.
archive_destination: The intended destination or use of the archive file.
archive_disposal_instructions: Instructions for how to dispose of the archive file when it is no longer needed (e.g. delete securely, transfer to another storage medium, etc.).
archive_encryption: Whether the archive is encrypted or not.
archive_format: The format of the archive file (e.g. ZIP, TAR, GZIP, RAR, etc.).
archive_frequency: The frequency with which the archive file is updated or created (e.g. daily, weekly, monthly, etc.).
archive_legal_compliance: Whether the archive file is created and maintained in compliance with legal or regulatory requirements (e.g. data protection laws, record retention regulations, etc.).
archive_license: The license under which the archive file is distributed or used.
archive_metadata: Additional metadata or descriptive information about the archive file and its contents (e.g. keywords, author, location, etc.).
archive_modified_date: The date and time when the archive file was last modified.
archive_owner: The name of the owner of the archive file.
archive_password_protected: Whether the archive is password-protected or not.
archive_permissions: The permissions set for the archive file (e.g. read-only, read-write, execute, etc.).
archive_publication_date: The date when the archive file was first published or made publicly available.
archive_purpose: A description of the intended purpose of the archive file (e.g. backup, distribution, storage, etc.).
archive_related_archives: A list of related archives or resources.
archive_relevance: The relevance or importance of the archive's contents to the organization or individual creating it.
archive_restore_instructions: Instructions for how to restore the contents of the archive file (e.g. which software to use, which files to extract, etc.).
archive_retention_period: The length of time for which the archive file should be retained.
archive_scope: The scope or extent of the archive's contents (e.g. a full system backup, a collection of related documents, etc.).
archive_size: The size of the archive file in bytes, kilobytes, megabytes, etc.
archive_source: The source or origin of the files contained within the archive.
archive_use_cases: Examples of situations in which the archive file might be used (e.g. disaster recovery, legal proceedings, etc.).
archive_version: The version number of the archive file format or software used to create it.
document_page_count: The number of pages in the document.
document_related: A list of related documents or resources.
file_accessibility: The level of accessibility of the file (e.g. public, private, restricted access, etc.).
file_author: The name of the author or creator of the file (if applicable).
file_category: The category or topic that the file content belongs to.
file_category_1: The top-level category or topic that the file content belongs to. This should not be Documents, Music, Pictures, Videos, Archives or Others, and not based on the file's mime-type
file_category_2: The second-level category or topic that the file content belongs to.
file_category_3: The third-level category or topic that the file content belongs to.
file_custom_attributes: Any additional custom attributes or metadata specific to the type of file being described.
file_date_created: The date that the file was created.
file_date_modified: The date that the file was last modified.
file_description: A brief description of the file.
file_format: The file format of the file (e.g. JPG, PNG, HTML, XML, etc.).
file_id: A 10 character descriptive unique ID for the file
file_keywords: A list of keywords or tags associated with the file.
file_language: The language of the file (if applicable).
file_license: The type of license associated with the file (e.g. Creative Commons, All rights reserved, etc.).
file_related_files: A list of related files or resources.
file_short_description: A shortest description of the file.
file_size: The file size of the file (in bytes).
file_source: The source or origin of the file (e.g. personal file, online resource, etc.).
file_summary: A brief summary or abstract of the contents of the file.
file_tags: A list of keywords or tags associated with the file.
movie_actors: Who are the main actors in the movie?
movie_awards: What awards has the movie won?
movie_category_1: What is the top-level category or topic that the movie belongs to?
movie_category_2: What is the second-level category or topic that the movie belongs to?
movie_category_3: What is the third-level category or topic that the movie belongs to?
movie_country: What country was the movie produced in?
movie_imdb_rating: What is the IMDb rating for the movie?
movie_imdb_votes: How many IMDb votes has the movie received?
movie_language: What language is the movie in?
movie_plot: What is the plot of the movie?
movie_poster: What is the URL for the movie poster?
movie_title: What is the title of the movie?
movie_type: What type of media is the movie (e.g. movie, series, episode)?
movie_year: What year was the movie released?
music_album: The title of the album that the music track appears on (if applicable).
music_album_artist: The name of the artist or group who created the album that the music track appears on (if applicable).
music_arranger: The name of the arranger who arranged the music track (if applicable).
music_artist: The name of the artist or group who created the music.
music_awards: The awards the music track has won or been nominated for.
music_bitrate: The bitrate of the music track (in kilobits per second).
music_bpm: The tempo of the music track, measured in beats per minute (BPM).
music_catalog_number: The catalog number assigned by the record label to the music track.
music_channels: The number of audio channels in the music track (e.g. mono, stereo, etc.).
music_composer: The name of the composer who created the music track (if applicable).
music_cover_art: A URL or file path to the cover art for the music track or album.
music_credits: The credits for the music track, including any additional musicians, songwriters, or producers.
music_genre: The genre of the music track (e.g. rock, pop, hip-hop, etc.).
music_guest_artist: The name of any guest artist who performed on the music track.
music_instruments: The instruments used in the music track.
music_isrc: The International Standard Recording Code (ISRC) for the music track.
music_key: The key of the music track (e.g. C major, G minor, etc.).
music_language: The language of the lyrics in the music track (if applicable).
music_length: The length of the music track (in seconds or minutes).
music_lyricist: The name of the lyricist who wrote the lyrics for the music track (if applicable).
music_mood: The mood or feeling evoked by the music track (e.g. happy, sad, energetic, etc.).
music_producer: The name of the producer who produced the video or music track (if applicable).
music_record_label: The name of the record label that released the music track.
music_release_date: The release date of the music track or album.
music_sample_rate: The sample rate of the music track (in Hertz).
music_subtitle: Any subtitle or additional information about the music track's title.
music_theme: The central theme or message of the music track.
music_track_number: The track number of the music track on the album (if applicable).
music_track_title: The title of the music track.
music_version: The version of the music track (e.g. radio edit, extended mix, etc.).
music_year: The year that the music track was released.
picture_camera_make: The make of the camera used to take the picture.
picture_camera_model: The model of the camera used to take the picture.
picture_credit: The credit or attribution for the picture (e.g. "Photo by John Smith").
picture_date_taken: The date the picture was taken.
picture_image_format: The file format of the picture (e.g. JPEG, PNG, etc.).
picture_image_resolution: The resolution of the picture (in pixels).
picture_image_size: The file size of the picture (in bytes).
picture_location_taken: The location where the picture was taken.
picture_photographer_name: The name of the photographer who took the picture.
video_aspect_ratio: The aspect ratio of the video (e.g. 16)
video_captions: A list of languages available for closed captions.
video_cast: A list of actors or performers who appear in the video.
video_director: The name of the director who created the video.
video_duration: The duration of the video (in seconds or minutes).
video_frame_rate: The frame rate of the video (in frames per second).
video_resolution: The resolution of the video (in pixels).
video_subtitles: A list of languages available for subtitles.
video_tv_total_seasons: How many seasons are there (if applicable)?
